Siempre, toda mi vida escuché de este juego, el legendario, el único y afamado Half-Life.
Con las expectativas que daba la gente desde aquellas épocas del loquendo, al no tener ningún contacto previo con este juego yo tenía la idea de que aquellas reseñas y opiniones de ser un juego super épico eran una exageración hasta ahora que lo pruebo...
Este juego sin dudas tenía muchos puntos adelantados a su época.
Un sólido 10/10, es tan bueno que si lo hubiera probado hace 10 años probablemente no lo hubiera entendido, ni mucho menos terminado.

Один из лучших шутеров "старой школы". да, коридорные уровни, да, графика морально устарела(для того года она была супер), но зато в ней нереальная атмосфера в которую погружаешься с головой. Хоть вторая часть и лучше по всем фронтам, но без этой игры не было бы и продолжения. Именно эта игра породила вселенную в которой существует Aperture Science, Black Mesa, Гордон Фриман, Челл, Барри который должен нам пива и другие персонажи. Она вошла в сердца многим геймерам и навечно там поселилась

在每次新机制引入的时，在摸清新机制前都会死很多次。其中大部分是以观察和耐心去解决的正常流程，但有个别几个感觉就是少了引导，印象最深的是，去xen之前拿到了推进背包，但没告诉我怎么用。到了xen之后就傻眼了，跳么跳不过去，推进背包么不知道怎么用，试了n种办法之后还是靠的百度解决的。
毕竟是早早期作品，相较于它的女儿们传送门1和2，我还是毫无保留地偏袒传送门1和2。目前为止我心中的v社最顶还是传送门系列。（没钱玩alyx）

Half-Life is an absolute classic. It's right up there with Doom, Quake and Blood as one of the most influential FPS games ever made. Half-Life 2 (and Half-Life: Alyx!) would go on to continue Half-Life's legacy of innovation.  

That being said, it's got some 90s jank, for sure. Maybe I'm just bad at the game, but I get killed by doors more often than I'd like to admit, and some scripting sequences have a tendency to kill me too LOL. I won't even talk about how jank ladders are...

Although I never played Half-Life when it first came out, I still find this game to be pretty darn appealing. Although it's an old school first-person, shooter, it manages to hold up for the most part. If you are a fan of sci-fi/horror you will more than likely appreciate this game. 

I find the controls are for the most part fluid. It very much reminds me of Doom controls in terms of how speedy your character moves around the environment. That being said, the most frustrating part of this game also include the controls in terms of the jumping mechanics and especially going up and down ladders. Despite these flaws, I was still able to obtain much enjoyment from the game.

The enemies in this game are pretty basic sci-fi horror tropes but they do provide a little bit of variety. Being a fairly old game, it doesn't feel incredibly intoxicating when you kill your enemies but despite how old it is, it still provides some pleasure when killing the various foes you encounter throughout your journey.

All in all, I loved the game's story-concept and most of the gameplay. Although I think it would be difficult for younger gamers to appreciate the old-school look and mechanics of the game, it can, with time, still be appreciated as the masterpiece it was and still is.
One of the best fps games I've played!

What can I say about this masterpiece? How can I even find the words to describe it? When it was first released I was 14 years old. Now I am 36 years old and still playing. Playing Half Life. It's like travelling back to my youth. And the experience is the same or even better. Felt like a masterpiece back in the days. Still feels like a masterpiece nowadays.
muito bom cara.

This game does not hold up as well as I'd hoped. It was fun for the first few hours, like, 7/10 kinds of fun. Nothing remarkable, but not bad either. Then it got to the point where nearly every room is some sort of trap, puzzle, or platforming segment designed in a way that will kill you before you can possibly think or react appropriately to avoid it, making the entire experience feel like a series of cheap deaths, trial and error, and the occasional reference to a walkthrough. I'm sure some folks will write me off as just being bad at the game, or being too stupid to comprehend how amazing it is for a game that came out in 1998, and make other such excuses to invalidate my opinion. I've played more than enough old games to know what I'm talking about. If I gave it some more effort and gave it a second playthrough, then sure, maybe I'd end up loving it, it's happened before. But much like other important games from the 90's, this one takes a tremendous amount of effort to have fun with. I respect this game for what innovations it brought to the table, but the number of times I groaned and said "Fuck I hate this game" while playing it started to add up to the point I can't heartily recommend it to newcomers without adding a thick air of caution. It's hard in a bad way. The kind of way that turns a three hour game into a ten hour game for the first playthrough.

Half-Life is a good experience and a great history lesson. The innovations it presents are taken for granted now (Barring needlessly minute AI programming that the player will likely never see in-game, such as programmed scents). The game is fun but definitely suffers from the poor shooting mechanics of Goldsrc (That later carried over to Source games). Guns feel floaty and non-impactful, some of the puzzles can be annoying. enemy AI is well-designed but fairly simplistic, and the difficulty is very inconsistent from moment-to-moment. There are definitely things that die-hard fans will defend as essential pieces of the experience, but to the average gamer they are simply annoyances.

Half-Life is an important part of FPS history, and that's where it's main value lies now, but it is still [i]fun[/i], even if that fun is at times bogged down by frustrating level design or mechanics. The fast paced, run and gun gameplay is addictive, and the weapons are fun to use and experiment with. The story and moment-to-moment scenes of interacting with the Black Mesa staff are enjoyable. The dialogue is humorous and the game knows when to be terrifying when it needs to. 

All in all I would recommend playing through it on medium difficulty and understanding the hype. If you're really interested in Half-Life, Black Mesa is a much more enjoyable experience but it would be wise to experience the original first. The Opposing Force expansion greatly improves on many aspects of this game by streamlining the experience and adding many more interesting weapons while cutting out the crap that plagued the first game. If you enjoy this title, I strongly recommend that one. 

4/5, a piece of history that has not aged well in many parts, but despite that, holds up strongly for pure fun factor.
